results.title: Living together
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Dealing with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Each program is made up of short sequences from films and videos stored in the archives of Film Australia. This program looks at the individual and society, discrimination, resolving differences between individuals and groups in our society, working together in groups for a variety of purposes and society in change. Presented by Annette Shun Wah

results.title: Learning about life
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Dealing with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Each program is made up of short sequences from films and videos stored in the archives of Film Australia. In this, the second of three programs dealing with Australia’s social environment, the underlying theme relates to socialisation, rites of passage, celebrations, the family, childhood training, formal education, peer group influences, informal education and learning throughout life. Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Women in change
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A history of Australia’s women looking specifically at: the suffragette movement; the campaign for equal pay; women and unionism; abortion; contraception, sexual harassment; and politics.

results.title: Rivers of delight: the Conway
results.brief_description: Broadcaster Wynford Vaughan-Thomas looks at the River Conway (Welsh spelling - Conwy) which rises in Snowdonia and reaches the sea on the North Wales coast at the town which bears its name. The Conway although only 30 miles long passes through landscape of immense variety starting as a fishing lake, gathering momentum at Betws-y-Coed, into the Swallow Falls and finally discharging into the sea at Conway Town.

results.title: Riverdance: the new show
results.creator_credit: John McColgan, Moya Doherty, Abhann Productions and Tyrone Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed at Radio City Music Hall, the Irish dance company Riverdance has won acclaim since they entered the Eurovision Song Contest. This program features their new show which toured Australia in 1996. Highlights of the show include “Homecoming”, “Trading Taps” and their classics “Riverdance”, “Thunderstorm” and “Heartland.” Starring principal dancers Jean Butler, Colin Dunne and Maria Pages.

results.title: Rise of industrial America: the rise of the American city
results.creator_credit: Paul Stein and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows that a major city is composed of an extraordinary diversity of individuals, many of whom came to the city to fulfil a private dream of success. Demonstrates that as immigrants came to the city, they changed and built it to fit their demands and desires, and that as they build the city, the city environment also changed them. Points out that those problems that confronted the city in the past are still major problems facing urban centres today.

results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman, Roger Morin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Rikki-tikki-tavi
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
An animated version of Rudyard Kipling’s tale of a mongoose who is saved from a storm by a boy and his parents, and then becomes the family’s defender against the dreaded cobras that roam the compound. Narrated by Orson Welles. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
